business.headline: PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.

From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

entertainment.headline: Ayushmann, Sharvari to begin shoot for Sooraj Barjatya's film in November: Report Ayushmann Khurrana and Sharvari will start shooting a new family entertainer directed by Sooraj Barjatya in November 2025. The collaboration signals another promising project following the success of 'Uunchai' and highlights Mahaveer Jain's expanding production ventures.

Lee Jung-jae shares selfie with SRK, expresses gratitude on meeting Bollywood icon Actor Lee Jung-jae shared a selfie with Shah Rukh Khan, expressing his admiration. The meeting excited fans who praised both actors as legends in their fields.

Mom-to-be Parineeti Chopra in Delhi ahead of delivery of first child: Report Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha prepare to welcome their first child as the 'Amar Singh Chamkila' actor nears the final stage of pregnancy. The duo had confirmed about the pregnancy in a social media post a while ago.

Salman brings whole family in new post for clothing line; Malaika, Seema feature too Salman Khan celebrated 12 years of his clothing brand with a gratitude note. His post highlights close family ties with Malaika Arora and Seema Sajdeh.

Dolly Singh becomes first Indian to win Instagram Golden Ring, calls it surreal Actor-influencer Dolly Singh has made history as the first Indian to win Instagram's Global 2025 Rings Award. This milestone recognises her bold creativity and influence on digital culture.

Mahabharat Ek Dharmayudh: An AI powered series on India's greatest mystical epic The AI-powered mystical series 'Mahabharat: Ek Dharmayudh', merges timeless Indian epic storytelling with cutting-edge technology, offering a new immersive viewing experience.

Rajat Bedi on daughter Vera's reaction to comparisons with Kareena, Aishwarya Actor Rajat Bedi's daughter Vera was compared to Kareena Kapoor Khan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan after her viral appearance at 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere. He reacted to the unexpected attention on Vera.

K-Ramp review: Kiran Abbavaram's comedy forgets sensitivity, logic, even humourRelease Date:Sat Oct 18, 2025 'K-Ramp' aims to be a loud, full-on comedy with emotional undertones, but it ends up confused, insensitive, and tone-deaf.

Ranveer Singh, Sreeleela team up in Rs 150 crore ad; Jawan fame Atlee directs Actor Ranveer Singh returns in an action-themed Ching's advert directed by Atlee, co-starring Sreeleela and Bobby Deol. With a reported budget of Rs 150 crore, the campaign surpasses several Bollywood films in scale.

She'll make you dance: Shabana Azmi's sweet warning to new father Arbaaz Khan Actor Arbaaz Khan and his wife Sshura welcomed their daughter, Sipaara, on October 5. Actor Shabana Azmi congratulated Arbaaz Khan and shared a good-natured warning about fatherhood.

Naagin 7 promo reveals epic Naagin vs Dragon clash at Kumbh The promo for 'Naagin 7' teases a confrontation between a naagin and a dragon at the Kumbh, introducing a new antagonist. The video has attracted mixed reactions, with some viewers criticising its concept and visual style.

52nd Daytime Emmys: David Attenborough becomes oldest winner, see full winners list The 2025 edition of the Daytime Emmy Awards, hosted by Mario Lopez, was held at Pasadena Civic Auditorium, California. 'General Hospital' won seven trophies.

Kajal Aggarwal celebrates sister Nisha's birthday with touching message Actor Kajal Aggarwal posted a touching birthday message for her sister Nisha Aggarwal on Instagram. The actor has completed shooting for 'The India Storry', a film based on true events involving pesticide scandals.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan says Shweta couldn't sleep after watching Kantara Rishabh Shetty recounted his humble beginnings and memorable moments in the film industry. Amitabh Bachchan praised Rishabh's performance in 'Kantara', sharing his daughter's strong reaction.

Taylor Swift donates $100,000 to young fan battling cancer with heartfelt message Pop sensation Taylor Swift donates USD 100,000 to a two-year-old fan, Lilah, undergoing cancer treatment. The donation came after Lilah's family shared her love for Swift on social media, sparking widespread attention.

Rashmika can't stop blushing as she's teased about engagement with Vijay. Watch Actor Rashmika Mandanna reacts to speculation about her engagement with Vijay Deverakonda. The pair's relationship continues to attract attention amid public appearances and online discussions.

Bhojpuri music is back in Hindi films but is Bollywood doing it dirty? From Panwadi to Aayi Nai, Bhojpuri beats are back in Bollywood. In this week's Cinematic Saturday we discuss if it is a true celebration of regional music or just another catchy imitation.

Salman praises Aryan Khan's debut, SRK's witty comeback steals the show Salman Khan commends Aryan Khan's directorial debut at Joy Forum in Riyadh. Shah Rukh Khan jokingly comments on Salman's potential future son.

Dangal actor Zaira Wasim gets married, shares post with husband Zaira Wasim, who left Bollywood in 2019 for religious reasons, announced her marriage with images from her nikaah ceremony.The former actor, known for her acclaimed roles in 'Dangal' and 'Secret Superstar', posted her first personal update in years.

general news.headline: Taliban snapping at Pak's heels, Asim Munir falls back on anti-India posturingPakistan Army Chief Asim Munir revived anti-India rhetoric at a cadet ceremony even as the military struggles against intensifying Taliban attacks. His remarks are being seen as an attempt to shift focus from the criticism back home.

Telangana shuts down over quota protest; shops, petrol pump attacked in HyderabadA bandh called by Backward Classes organisations demanding restoration of 42% reservation in local bodies led to the shutdown of shops, businesses, and transport across Telangana. The protest drew broad political support and left Diwali travellers stranded.

Yusuf Pathan visits disputed Adina mosque. Why has it stirred a row?Adina mosque row: Recently, former cricketer Yusuf Pathan visited the Adina Mosque in Bengal and called it an architectural marvel. The BJP and social media users pointed out that it was the Adinath temple. What is the dispute all about?

8 pilgrims killed in Maharashtra after bus loses control, falls into ravineSeveral passengers were injured and rushed to nearby hospitals. The site of the accident is known for its steep and dangerous terrain, making travel risky for vehicles.

Massive fire at Dhaka airport, flight ops resume after over 6 hoursA fire erupted at the cargo terminal of Dhaka's Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport on Saturday afternoon, leading to the suspension of all flight operations.

Glitch forces Air India to cancel Milan-Delhi flight before Diwali; flyers strandedAn Air India Milan–Delhi flight scheduled for October 17 was cancelled due to technical issues, leaving hundreds stranded in Italy just before Diwali.

Mohun Bagan beat East Bengal in shootout to claim first IFA Shield title in 22 yearsMohun Bagan Super Giant overcame arch-rivals East Bengal 5-4 on penalties after a 1-1 draw in the 125th IFA Shield final at Salt Lake Stadium, bringing home their 21st title and ending a 22-year wait.

Alimony can't be granted to financially independent spouse: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court's decision emphasises that alimony is meant to support genuinely needy spouses, not to provide enrichment for those with substantial incomes.

Video: Battery fire on Air China flight's overhead bin sparks panic among flyersThe plane diverted to Shanghai Pudong International Airport after a passenger's lithium battery, stored in the overhead compartment, unexpectedly caught fire.

Punjab suspends senior cop HS Bhullar after jail term in Rs 8 lakh bribery caseA day after Punjab's Deputy Inspector General of Police (Ropar Range), Harcharan Singh Bhullar, was sent to 14-day judicial custody in connection with a Rs 8 lakh bribery case, the Bhagwant Mann government suspended the senior police official.

Chandrayaan-2 watches as explosion from Sun hits the MoonBecause the Moon lacks both a substantial atmosphere and a global magnetic field, it is particularly vulnerable to solar activity. As nations and companies plan long-duration missions and surface habitats, understanding the Moon's response to solar disturbances will be critical.

Rohit, Virat back for final dash, ODI captain Gill eyes smooth take-offAustralia vs India, 1st ODI: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will return to Indian colours after seven months as Shubman Gill makes his debut as full-time ODI captain in the first match against Australia in Perth on Sunday.

Every inch within BrahMos range: Rajnath Singh's big warning to PakistanDefence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday issued a stark warning to Pakistan, saying every inch of India's neighbour was within the range of BrahMos missiles, even as he called Operation Sindoor merely a trailer.

JMM goes solo in Bihar, to contest 6 seats. Blow to Mahagathbandhan?The JMM has picked Chakai, Dhamdaha, Katoria (ST), Pirpainti, Manihari (ST) and Jamui assembly seats and will not be contesting as part of the Mahagathbandhan.

BCCI and ICC condemn deadly Pak airstrike that killed 3 Afghan cricketersBoth the BCCI and the ICC have released separate statements which condemn the recent airstrike that took place in Afghanistan's Paktika province which claimed the lives of three young Afghan cricketers.

IND vs AUS: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's lives come full circle in AustraliaRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have earned a reputation as true match-winners with their remarkable performances in Australia over the years. However, they now return to the country under intense scrutiny, with a new generation of youngsters waiting to step into their shoes.

How Manav Subodh's 1M1B is turning young Indians into global climate leadersManav Subodh built 1M1B (1 Million for 1 Billion) from village pilot phases to a United Nations-linked movement. Now he trains youth in green skills, blends AI and local knowledge, and aims to convert India's youth dividend into climate action to keep global warming below 1.5°C.

Major fire breaks out at MPs' quarters near Parliament, blame game eruptsA massive fire broke out at Brahmaputra Apartments on BD Marg in Delhi, which houses several Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MPs. Fire engines rushed to the spot while the cause of the blaze remains unknown.

3 Afghan cricketers killed in Pak air strike, cricket board withdraws from seriesThe Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) on Saturday claimed that three domestic cricketers were killed in a Pakistani airstrike in Paktika. In response, the ACB announced the cancellation of a tri-series that was scheduled to be held in Lahore and Rawalpindi in November.

PCB is actively seeking a replacement team, keeping the event on schedule amid rising tensions with Afghanistan.

Not concerned with collapse vs Pakistan, need to move on quickly: Charlotte Edwards Charlotte Edwards dismisses concerns over batting collapse against Pakistan. She focuses on overcoming India's home advantage in the upcoming match.

Pakistan-Afghanistan Conflict: India's BCCI Slams Pak Airstrike That Killed 3 Young Afghan Players This special report covers the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) condoling the tragic loss of three young Afghan cricketers, Kabir Agha, Sigbhutullah, and Haroon, in Paktika province. The players were killed in what the transcript describes as a 'cowardly cross-border airstrike'. The BCCI stated, 'We stand in solidarity with the Afghanistan Cricket Board, the cricket fraternity and the families of the departed players'. The report also notes the significant fallout from the incident, with the Afghanistan Cricket Board deciding to withdraw from a planned tri-nation T20I series that was to include Pakistan and Sri Lanka. The BCCI's statement expressed deep sorrow, highlighting that the loss of promising sportspersons is a matter of great concern and shared its sympathies with the people of Afghanistan during this difficult time.

Nottingham Forest sack Ange Postecoglou moments after Chelsea thrashingNottingham Forest have sacked manager Ange Postecoglou following their 0-3 loss to Chelsea on Sunday, October 18. Postecoglou failed to win any of his games in charge of the club as they edge closer to relegation.

Watch: Ellyse Perry gets trendy new hairstyle from local Vizag girlEllyse Perry showcased her fun side at the Women's World Cup 2025, getting a stylish new hairstyle from a local girl in Visakhapatnam. Earlier, Perry's unbeaten 47 helped Australia to a record-breaking chase against India.

Game-changer Harmanpreet Kaur will be back to her best vs England: Deepti SharmaIndia all-rounder Deepti Sharma said that the team is firmly behind Harmanpreet Kaur and tipped the captain to regain her form against England. Harmanpreet has struggled to find her rhythm in the tournament so far.

India should pick Harshit Rana for 1st ODI vs Australia: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra urged India to play Harshit Rana in the first ODI against Australia in Perth. The young pacer could exploit the bouncy Australian conditions and finally show why selectors have backed him.

India just one good game away from bouncing back stronger: Deepti SharmaWomen's World Cup, IND vs ENG: Deepti Sharma said that India are more than capable of bouncing back in their game against England after facing back-to-back losses at the hands of South Africa and Australia.

Afghan Cricket Board Quits Pakistan Tri-Series After Airstrikes | Opposition Parties Slam BCCIThis special report focuses on the escalating tensions between Pakistan and Afghanistan after alleged Pakistani airstrikes in Paktika province killed civilians, including three domestic cricketers. An opposition leader stated, 'agar reed behen pradhanmantri ho lachar pradhanmantri ho to...atankvad aur khel sath chal sakta hai' (if there is a spineless and helpless Prime Minister...terrorism and sports can go together). The Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has withdrawn from an upcoming T20 tri-series with Pakistan and Sri Lanka in protest, a decision supported by captain Rashid Khan who condemned the attacks as 'barbaric'. This has triggered a political debate in India, with opposition parties questioning the BCCI and the Indian government's policy of playing against Pakistan in multi-nation tournaments, suggesting India should learn from the ACB's decisive stand against terrorism.

Rain washes off India's training session in Indore before England clashRain disrupted India's preparations ahead of their Women's World Cup clash against England, while the team's campaign has been a mix of wins over Sri Lanka and Pakistan and defeats to South Africa and Australia.

Mohammed Shami sets up Bengal's big win in Ranji trophy, sends message to AgarkarMohammed Shami made a strong statement by setting up Bengal's win in the Ranji Trophy with a four-wicket burst against Uttarakhand on Saturday, October 18. Shami also sent a message to Ajit Agarkar before his spell.

Sri Lanka to seek Interpol red notices for athletes who fled 2022 Commonwealth GamesSri Lanka will seek Interpol red notices to arrest athletes who fled the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham and failed to return home, causing a financial loss of about 50 million rupees, officials told a Colombo court on Friday.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
